bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Philip Showalter Hench, January 20, 1942

div1.p: Kellogg sends Hench a proof of the plates for the Cuban version of the yellow fever painting.

div1.head: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Philip Showalter Hench, January 20, 1942

opener.dateline:
GEORGE A. KELLOGG
257 CORNELISON AVENUE
JERSEY CITY, N.J.
January 20, 1942

div1.p:
Your suggestion for a publication
carrying the reviews of all plays here in New York
City seems to have been a little late. Someone has
stolen a march on us and is already putting out
this type of publication. I enclose an ad which I
clipped from last Sunday's NEW YORK TIMES. The
price which they ask for it is higher than we dream-
ed of getting. I wonder who will be willing to sub-
scribe at $15 per year.

Enclosed with this letter also find a
proof of the plates which we had made on the “Cuban”
version of “Yellow Fever.” I can supply you with a
complete set of electros as shown in this picture
without charge if any of your publishing friends care
to use them. We can also supply a set of electros on
the “Conquerors of Yellow Fever” picture as it appear-
ed in the magazine, HYGEIA.

I hope that you and Mrs. Hench are hav-
ing a good trip. There is a package on my desk which
looks as though it might have come from you. I will
write you about that after I have taken it home.
div1.closer:
Sincerely George A. Kellogg GAK:L
Enclosures (4)
